meanings.definition: Overwhelmed or inundated with an excessive amount of work or tasks.
meanings.sent1: She felt swamped with all the homework assignments.
meanings.sent2: The team was swamped with orders during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The poor cat looked swamped by the pile of toys around it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was swamped with thoughts of what to do next.
meanings.sent5: The students were swamped with excitement on the last day of school.

meanings.definition: Filled or covered with water or liquid.
meanings.sent1: The swamped field was too wet to walk through.
meanings.sent2: The boat struggled to move through the swamped area.
meanings.sent3: The swamped sponge absorbed all the spilled juice.
meanings.sent4: The swamped basement needed to be pumped out after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The swamped garden was a result of heavy rain overnight.

meanings.sent1: The heavy rain swamped the streets, causing flooding.
meanings.sent2: The river swamped the nearby houses after the dam broke.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally swamped his phone by dropping it in the pool.
meanings.sent4: The boat started to sink as water swamped in from the waves.
meanings.sent5: The sudden storm swamped the entire town, leaving everything underwater.
